level.introtext: Color in our monitor needs to be represented with a number!
level.endtext: Alphanumeric! You saved information using VARIABLES!
level.code: Variables are how you store information in a program. color_blue = 255 color_blue is the name of the variable; that's how we reference it later 255 is the value of the variable Variables stay in memory until they are changed. You can reference the variables later using their names. When you run the code, you can output those variables using print Variables are only used for mathematical formulas There are no other type of variables except for integers print(color_blue)
